subject: Fashion
title: Punk's Safety Pin Revolt
description: A 1-minute de-risking session on Punk's Safety Pin Revolt.

hook.text: In 1977, a teenager held her torn shirt together with a safety pin. That pin became a movement.

buildup.text: Punk fashion was built from destruction: ripped clothes, garbage bags, razor blades as jewelry.

discovery.text: Vivienne Westwood and Malcolm McLaren sold punk from their London shop SEXâ€”chaos with a price tag.

twist.text: Punk said 'anyone can do this.' But the look took as much effort as coutureâ€”just inverted.

climax.text: Safety pins appeared on Versace runways by the 1990s. Punk's anti-fashion became high fashion.

punchline.text: The safety pin went from survival tool to runway icon.

quiz.question: How did punk fashion eventually influence mainstream style?
options: It replaced all formal wear with torn clothing permanently
Punk elements like safety pins appeared on luxury runways by the 1990s
It had no lasting influence on mainstream fashion
